Package src.logic

Class Game

java.lang.Object
src.logic.Game
public class Game extends Object
the Game class uses a Board object to implement the games logic, controls the turn order of the player and is used to process the communication with the opponent

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    boolean[]
    gui_dir
    array that the Mainframe uses to initialize the battlescreen when a game is loaded

    s_len
    array that the Mainframe uses to initialize the battlescreen when a game is loaded

    size
    board size
    int
    u_turn
    1 = it's the players turn; 0 = it's the opponents turn; 2 = game over

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(int size, int[] ship_set, NetworkPlayer n)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    get_hit(Coordinate p)
    when the opponent is shooting at the players Board the Game automatically answers and forwards the Coordinate and answer to the gui to visualize the shot
    void
    load_game(String filepath)
    reads data from a file that saved the previous Game session to initialize a Board object to the same position as before and start the Battlescreen in the same state as the Board
    void
    load_gui()
    syncs the gui to the board object when a game is loaded from a file
    void
    save_game()
    saves the Game by calling the Board objects save_game() method and sends save id to the network so the enemy also saves its own Game state
    void
    save_opp_game(String file)
    identical to save_game, but this time the enemy wants to save the Game instead of the user
    void
    send_shot(int x, int y)
    forwards the Coordinate the user is shooting at to the network after the opponent answers register the shot for potential saving and properly choose whos turn it is or if the user won
    void
    set_gui(Battlescreen b)
    sets the Battlescreen and converts the bool direction array that the gui uses into the int direction array the logic uses
    void
    setup_board()
    szncs the Board with the Battlescreen after the user placed all his ships
    void
    start_local_turn()
    checks if the Game is over, if not allows the user to play by activating the users ui
    void
    start_opp_turn()
    checks if the Game is over, if not allows the enemy to play its turn by listening for a shot, save or pass

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      1 = it's the players turn; 0 = it's the opponents turn; 2 = game over

  • Method Details

    • load_game

      public void load_game(String filepath)
      reads data from a file that saved the previous Game session to initialize a Board object to the same position as before and start the Battlescreen in the same state as the Board
      Parameters:
      filepath - the name of a file that stores Game data from a previous Game session

    • load_gui

      public void load_gui()
      syncs the gui to the board object when a game is loaded from a file

    • set_gui

      public void set_gui(Battlescreen b)
      sets the Battlescreen and converts the bool direction array that the gui uses into the int direction array the logic uses
      Parameters:
      b -

    • setup_board

      public void setup_board()
      szncs the Board with the Battlescreen after the user placed all his ships

    • send_shot

      public void send_shot(int x, int y)
      forwards the Coordinate the user is shooting at to the network after the opponent answers register the shot for potential saving and properly choose whos turn it is or if the user won
      Parameters:
      x - horizontal position of the shot fired by the user
      y - vertical position of the shot fired by the user

    • save_game

      public void save_game()
      saves the Game by calling the Board objects save_game() method and sends save id to the network so the enemy also saves its own Game state

    • save_opp_game

      public void save_opp_game(String file)
      identical to save_game, but this time the enemy wants to save the Game instead of the user
      Parameters:
      file -

    • get_hit

      public void get_hit(Coordinate p)
      when the opponent is shooting at the players Board the Game automatically answers and forwards the Coordinate and answer to the gui to visualize the shot
      Parameters:
      p - Coordinate of the position the opponent is shooting at

    • start_local_turn

      public void start_local_turn()
      checks if the Game is over, if not allows the user to play by activating the users ui

    • start_opp_turn

      public void start_opp_turn()
      checks if the Game is over, if not allows the enemy to play its turn by listening for a shot, save or pass
